channel.title: üè¢ University of Michigan on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of Michigan on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Abrupt Learning in Transformers: A Case Study on Matrix Completion
item.description: Transformers exhibit abrupt learning: training loss plateaus, then suddenly drops. This study uses matrix completion to demonstrate this phenomenon, providing insights into the model’s algorithmic sh…

item.title: AutoGuide: Automated Generation and Selection of Context-Aware Guidelines for Large Language Model Agents
item.description: AutoGuide: Automated generation of context-aware guidelines significantly improves LLM agent performance in unfamiliar domains.

item.title: BLAST: Block-Level Adaptive Structured Matrices for Efficient Deep Neural Network Inference
item.description: BLAST matrix learns efficient weight structures for faster deep learning inference, achieving significant compression and performance gains on various models.

item.title: CONTRAST: Continual Multi-source Adaptation to Dynamic Distributions
item.description: CONTRAST efficiently adapts multiple source models to dynamic data distributions by optimally weighting models and selectively updating only the most relevant ones, achieving robust performance withou…

item.title: DiffusionBlend: Learning 3D Image Prior through Position-aware Diffusion Score Blending for 3D Computed Tomography Reconstruction
item.description: DiffusionBlend++ learns a 3D image prior via position-aware diffusion score blending, achieving state-of-the-art 3D CT reconstruction with superior efficiency.

item.title: DiffusionPDE: Generative PDE-Solving under Partial Observation
item.description: DiffusionPDE uses generative diffusion models to solve PDEs accurately, even with highly incomplete observations, outperforming state-of-the-art methods.

item.title: Distributed Least Squares in Small Space via Sketching and Bias Reduction
item.description: Researchers developed a novel sparse sketching method for distributed least squares regression, achieving near-unbiased estimates with optimal space and time complexity.

item.title: Distributionally Robust Performative Prediction
item.description: This research introduces distributionally robust performative prediction, offering a new solution concept (DRPO) that minimizes performative risk even with misspecified distribution maps, ensuring rob…

item.title: Efficient Contextual LLM Cascades through Budget-Constrained Policy Learning
item.description: TREACLE: a reinforcement learning policy efficiently selects LLMs and prompts, achieving up to 85% cost savings while maintaining high accuracy in answering reasoning questions.

item.title: Efficient multi-prompt evaluation of LLMs
item.description: PromptEval efficiently estimates LLM performance across many prompts, providing robust performance metrics and enabling reliable LLM comparisons.

item.title: Exploring Low-Dimensional Subspace in Diffusion Models for Controllable Image Editing
item.description: LOCO Edit achieves precise, localized image editing in diffusion models via a single-step, training-free method leveraging low-dimensional semantic subspaces.

item.title: Exploring the trade-off between deep-learning and explainable models for brain-machine interfaces
item.description: KalmanNet, a novel BMI decoder, achieves state-of-the-art performance by integrating recurrent neural networks into Kalman filtering, balancing accuracy and explainability.

item.title: FIDE: Frequency-Inflated Conditional Diffusion Model for Extreme-Aware Time Series Generation
item.description: FIDE, a novel conditional diffusion model, accurately generates time series by inflating high-frequency components, preserving extreme value distributions.

item.title: Fine-grained Analysis of In-context Linear Estimation: Data, Architecture, and Beyond
item.description: Researchers crack the code of in-context learning in Transformers, revealing how architecture, low-rank parameters, and data correlations influence model optimization and generalization.

item.title: From Unstructured Data to In-Context Learning: Exploring What Tasks Can Be Learned and When
item.description: LLMs’ in-context learning surprisingly arises from simple co-occurrence patterns in unstructured data, but positional information is key for complex tasks; ICL fails when patterns are unseen or fixed.

item.title: Globally Convergent Variational Inference
item.description: Researchers achieve globally convergent variational inference by minimizing the expected forward KL divergence, overcoming the limitations of traditional methods.

item.title: Image Reconstruction Via Autoencoding Sequential Deep Image Prior
item.description: aSeqDIP: A new unsupervised image reconstruction method using sequential deep image priors, achieving competitive performance with fewer data needs and faster runtimes.

item.title: Images that Sound: Composing Images and Sounds on a Single Canvas
item.description: Researchers create ‘images that sound’‚Äîvisual spectrograms looking like natural images and sounding like natural audio‚Äîby cleverly composing pre-trained image and audio diffusion models in a shared la…

item.title: Is Your LiDAR Placement Optimized for 3D Scene Understanding?
item.description: Place3D optimizes LiDAR placement for superior 3D scene understanding.

item.title: Label Noise: Ignorance Is Bliss
item.description: Ignorance is bliss: A new framework shows ignoring label noise in multi-class classification can achieve state-of-the-art performance, especially when using self-supervised feature extraction.

item.title: Learn To be Efficient: Build Structured Sparsity in Large Language Models
item.description: Learn-To-be-Efficient (LTE) trains LLMs to achieve structured sparsity, boosting inference speed by 25% at 50% sparsity without sacrificing accuracy.

item.title: Learning Image Priors Through Patch-Based Diffusion Models for Solving Inverse Problems
item.description: PaDIS: Patch-based diffusion inverse solver learns efficient image priors from image patches, enabling high-resolution inverse problem solutions with reduced computational costs and data needs.

item.title: Multi-Object Hallucination in Vision Language Models
item.description: LVLMs often hallucinate objects, a problem worsened when multiple objects are present. This paper introduces ROPE, a novel automated evaluation protocol that reveals how object class distribution and…

item.title: On the Computational Complexity of Private High-dimensional Model Selection
item.description: This paper proposes a computationally efficient, differentially private best subset selection method for high-dimensional sparse linear regression, achieving both strong statistical utility and provab…

item.title: On the Impact of Feature Heterophily on Link Prediction with Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) struggle with heterophilic link prediction; this paper introduces formal definitions, theoretical analysis, improved designs, and real-world benchmarks to address this cha…

item.title: Online Classification with Predictions
item.description: Online learning algorithms can now leverage predictions about future data to achieve significantly lower regret, smoothly transitioning between worst-case and best-case performance based on prediction…

item.title: Preference-based Pure Exploration
item.description: PreTS algorithm efficiently identifies the most preferred policy in bandit problems with vector-valued rewards, achieving asymptotically optimal sample complexity.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning Under Latent Dynamics: Toward Statistical and Algorithmic Modularity
item.description: This paper pioneers a modular framework for reinforcement learning, addressing the challenge of learning under complex observations and simpler latent dynamics, offering both statistical and algorithm…

item.title: RoME: A Robust Mixed-Effects Bandit Algorithm for Optimizing Mobile Health Interventions
item.description: RoME, a robust contextual bandit algorithm, leverages mixed-effects modeling and debiased machine learning to optimize personalized mobile health interventions, achieving superior performance in simul…

item.title: Selective Attention: Enhancing Transformer through Principled Context Control
item.description: Enhance Transformer models via Selective Self-Attention (SSA), a principled context control method that boosts accuracy and efficiency.

item.title: Smoothed Online Classification can be Harder than Batch Classification
item.description: Smoothed online classification can be harder than batch classification when label spaces are unbounded, challenging existing assumptions in machine learning.

item.title: The Implicit Bias of Gradient Descent on Separable Multiclass Data
item.description: Researchers extended implicit bias theory to multiclass classification using a novel framework, proving that gradient descent prefers simple solutions even with complex alternatives.

item.title: Understanding Generalizability of Diffusion Models Requires Rethinking the Hidden Gaussian Structure
item.description: Diffusion models’ surprising generalizability stems from an inductive bias towards learning Gaussian data structures, a finding that reshapes our understanding of their training and generalization.

item.title: Weak Supervision Performance Evaluation via Partial Identification
item.description: This paper introduces a novel method for evaluating weakly supervised models using Fr√©chet bounds, providing reliable performance bounds without ground truth labels.

item.title: Who‚Äôs Gaming the System? A Causally-Motivated Approach for Detecting Strategic Adaptation
item.description: Researchers developed a causally-motivated approach for ranking agents based on their gaming propensity, addressing the challenge of identifying ‘worst offenders’ in strategic classification settings.
